questions.questionText: What is required for a seller to complete when selling a residential property with one to four dwelling units?
options: A) Real Estate Condition Report
B) Rental Agreement
C) Agency Disclosure Form
D) Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) Form
questions.explanation: Sellers of residential properties with one to four units must complete a Real Estate Condition Report under Wisconsin law.

questions.questionText: Who must draft an addendum that modifies non-optional provisions of an approved form?
options: A) The licensee
B) The buyer
C) An attorney
D) The broker
questions.explanation: Only an attorney can draft an addendum that changes non-optional provisions of an approved form.

questions.questionText: What must a licensee provide to a customer before negotiations begin?
options: A) Disclosure to Customers Form
B) Real Estate Condition Report
C) Listing Contract
D) Rental Agreement
questions.explanation: Wisconsin law requires agency disclosure to a customer before negotiations start.

questions.questionText: What is the WB-37 Residential Listing Contract used for?
options: A) Selling commercial property
B) Leasing residential property
C) Leasing vacant land
D) Managing a property
questions.explanation: The WB-37 is used for listing residential property for lease.

questions.questionText: Who can use State Bar forms for real estate transactions?
options: A) Licensed salespersons and brokers
B) Only licensed brokers
C) All real estate licensees
D) Property owners
questions.explanation: Only licensed brokers can use State Bar forms.

questions.questionText: When must agency disclosure be provided to a client?
options: A) Before or at the time of entering into an agency agreement
B) After signing the purchase agreement
C) At the time of property closing
D) During the first property showing
questions.explanation: Agency disclosure must occur before or at the time of entering into an agency agreement.

questions.questionText: What should a licensee do if presented with a form not approved by the state?
options: A) Draft missing sections of the form
B) Refer the form to their broker for review
C) Follow all state laws and ensure no important protections are missing
D) Refuse to use the form
questions.explanation: Licensees must ensure compliance with Wisconsin law and confirm important protections are present.

questions.questionText: What is an example of a pre-prepared addendum?
options: A) A custom contingency for asbestos testing
B) A firm’s standard well-testing addendum
C) A unique personal property list
D) A handwritten amendment by the buyer
questions.explanation: Pre-prepared addenda are standard forms used to address common contingencies like well-testing.

questions.questionText: What must a seller of vacant land complete?
options: A) A vacant land disclosure report
B) A Real Estate Condition Report
C) An Agency Disclosure Form
D) A Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) Form
questions.explanation: Sellers of vacant land are required to complete a vacant land disclosure report.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of a Disclosure to Clients form?
options: A) To provide agency disclosure to clients
B) To outline the seller’s property condition
C) To specify buyer financing terms
D) To list personal property included in the sale
questions.explanation: The Disclosure to Clients form ensures compliance with agency disclosure requirements for clients.

questions.questionText: What must a licensee do before listing a property?
options: A) Inspect the property and ask the seller about its condition
B) Obtain a full inspection report from a third-party inspector
C) Confirm the buyer’s financial capability
D) Provide an earnest money agreement
questions.explanation: Licensees are required to inspect the property and inquire about its condition.

questions.questionText: Who drafts a property management agreement?
options: A) The landlord
B) A broker, landlord, or attorney
C) The supervising broker only
D) A real estate salesperson
questions.explanation: A property management agreement can be drafted by a broker, landlord, or attorney.

questions.questionText: What must be included in a pre-prepared addendum?
options: A) Optional and multiple-choice provisions
B) Only provisions related to blanks or optional sections of approved forms
C) A complete rewrite of the approved form
D) Buyer’s handwritten notes
questions.explanation: Pre-prepared addenda must relate to blanks or optional sections in approved forms.

questions.questionText: Who is responsible for ensuring the use of proper forms in a firm?
options: A) The seller
B) The broker
C) The buyer
D) The state agency
questions.explanation: The broker ensures that licensees in the firm comply with form usage rules.

questions.questionText: What must a licensee do to properly incorporate an addendum into a contract?
options: A) Attach it physically and reference it in the contract
B) Only attach it to the contract
C) Obtain verbal agreement from all parties
D) Include it without referencing it in the contract
questions.explanation: Addenda must be attached and explicitly referenced in the contract.

questions.questionText: What is the primary limitation on salespersons using State Bar forms?
options: A) Salespersons cannot use State Bar forms at all
B) Salespersons can only use forms for commercial transactions
C) Salespersons must obtain prior approval from their broker
D) Salespersons must co-sign with an attorney
questions.explanation: State Bar forms can only be used by licensed brokers.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of a firm’s contingency manual?
options: A) To draft additional forms
B) To provide guidelines for using transaction documents
C) To train clients on legal requirements
D) To serve as a substitute for attorney advice
questions.explanation: Contingency manuals guide licensees in using transaction documents and ensuring compliance.

questions.questionText: What document is used when renting a residential property in Wisconsin?
options: A) WB-37 Residential Listing Contract
B) Uniform Commercial Code Form
C) Disclosure to Clients Form
D) Approved rental agreement
questions.explanation: The WB-37 is used to list residential properties for rent.

questions.questionText: When is it necessary for a licensee to consult an attorney?
options: A) When drafting standard forms for a transaction
B) When creating complex provisions like environmental liability waivers
C) When conducting property inspections
D) When completing a Real Estate Condition Report
questions.explanation: Attorneys should draft complex provisions such as environmental liability waivers.

questions.questionText: What must a broker verify before using another state’s form?
options: A) That the broker’s license is valid in the other state
B) That they are competent to use the form and follow the other state’s laws
C) That the form is pre-approved by their supervising broker
D) That the form is simplified for Wisconsin use
questions.explanation: Brokers must ensure competence and compliance with the other state’s laws before using its forms.

questions.questionText: What is the primary limitation when using a form without a WB identification number?
options: A) Licensees can only sign the form but cannot fill in blanks or draft provisions
B) Licensees can use the form as they wish
C) The form must be rewritten to meet WB standards
D) The form is automatically invalid
questions.explanation: Licensees are restricted to signing such forms and cannot modify or fill in blanks.

questions.questionText: What must a licensee do when using an unapproved listing contract?
options: A) Rewrite the form to include necessary provisions
B) Ensure compliance with Wisconsin law and agency disclosure obligations
C) Submit the form for REEB approval before use
D) Only use it with residential properties
questions.explanation: Licensees must follow Wisconsin law and ensure agency disclosures are provided.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of a Disclosure to Customers form?
options: A) To clarify legal obligations of the broker
B) To comply with mandatory agency disclosure laws for customers
C) To summarize the listing contract terms
D) To document buyer financing
questions.explanation: This form ensures compliance with agency disclosure requirements for customers.

questions.questionText: Who is required to complete a vacant land disclosure report?
options: A) All sellers
B) Sellers of vacant land
C) Sellers of commercial property
D) Only brokers
questions.explanation: Sellers of vacant land must complete a vacant land disclosure report.

questions.questionText: What is required for an addendum to alter a non-optional provision of an approved form?
options: A) Approval by the REEB
B) Drafting by an attorney identified on the addendum
C) Inclusion of multiple-choice options
D) Signature from all parties before incorporation
questions.explanation: Non-optional provisions can only be altered by an attorney-drafted addendum.

questions.questionText: What must a licensee confirm when incorporating an addendum into an approved form?
options: A) That it is signed by all parties before delivery
B) That it is referenced in the approved form and properly related to it
C) That it includes optional and fill-in provisions
D) That it is rewritten to match approved forms’ formatting
questions.explanation: Proper incorporation requires referencing and relating the addendum to the approved form.

questions.questionText: When must a seller provide a Real Estate Condition Report to a buyer?
options: A) Before listing the property
B) Within 10 days of accepting an offer
C) At the time of closing
D) Before property showings
questions.explanation: Wisconsin law requires sellers to provide the report within 10 days of offer acceptance.

questions.questionText: What is the role of the broker in using State Bar forms?
options: A) To approve salesperson use of the forms
B) To ensure the broker is competent in completing the forms
C) To rewrite the forms to align with WB standards
D) To draft provisions for the forms
questions.explanation: Brokers must be competent to use State Bar forms appropriately.

questions.questionText: What is a limitation of a licensee acting as a property manager?
options: A) They cannot sign rental agreements
B) They must hold a real estate license if signing or negotiating leases
C) They are prohibited from marketing rental properties
D) They cannot perform maintenance tasks
questions.explanation: Signing or negotiating leases requires a real estate license.

questions.questionText: What must be included in a property management agreement?
options: A) A complete listing of tenants
B) Provisions for leasing, marketing, and overall management
C) Standard addenda for residential properties
D) Pre-approval by the REEB
questions.explanation: Property management agreements must include provisions for leasing, marketing, and management.

questions.questionText: What is a key consideration when using another state’s real estate forms?
options: A) Ensuring the form is notarized
B) Determining if the licensee is competent and permitted to use the form under that state’s laws
C) Verifying that the form aligns with Wisconsin statutes
D) Confirming it is a WB-approved form
questions.explanation: Licensees must ensure competence and compliance with the laws of the other state before using its forms.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of a firm’s contingency manual?
options: A) To outline rules for resolving disputes
B) To provide guidelines for using other transaction documents
C) To replace attorney-drafted provisions
D) To train customers on transaction processes
questions.explanation: Contingency manuals guide licensees in proper use of documents and compliance.

questions.questionText: When should a licensee recommend consulting an attorney for drafting provisions?
options: A) When the licensee is unsure about filling in blanks
B) For complex legal provisions like rights of first refusal or environmental waivers
C) When the form includes blanks for personal property listings
D) For writing standard contingencies
questions.explanation: Complex legal provisions should always be drafted by an attorney.

questions.questionText: What must a licensee do when using pre-prepared addenda?
options: A) Include blanks and fill-in provisions
B) Ensure the addenda are incorporated by reference into an approved form
C) Reformat the addenda to match approved forms
D) Deliver addenda without referencing them in the contract
questions.explanation: Proper incorporation requires referencing the addenda in the approved form.

questions.questionText: What is a broker’s responsibility regarding UCC forms?
options: A) To rewrite UCC forms to align with WB standards
B) To ensure competence or refer parties to an attorney
C) To confirm all licensees in the firm can use UCC forms
D) To file UCC forms with the Wisconsin Real Estate Board
questions.explanation: Brokers must be competent to use UCC forms or refer parties to an attorney.

questions.questionText: What is a risk of using an unapproved listing contract?
options: A) It might not include protections like rights to protected buyers
B) The contract becomes automatically void
C) It cannot include agency disclosure
D) It can only be used for commercial properties
questions.explanation: Unapproved contracts often lack important protections like those for protected buyers.

questions.questionText: Who can draft provisions for pre-prepared addenda?
options: A) The licensee or broker only
B) A broker or attorney
C) Any party involved in the transaction
D) The supervising broker exclusively
questions.explanation: Pre-prepared addenda must be drafted by a broker or attorney.

questions.questionText: What distinguishes a property management agreement from a rental listing contract?
options: A) It is only used for residential properties
B) It includes additional management and maintenance duties
C) It is a standardized WB-approved form
D) It excludes provisions for collecting rent
questions.explanation: Property management agreements include broader duties than rental listing contracts.

questions.questionText: When must agency disclosure to a customer occur?
options: A) At the time of writing an offer
B) Before the start of negotiations
C) At the time of closing
D) During property showings
questions.explanation: Agency disclosure must occur before negotiations begin.

questions.questionText: What must a licensee confirm before using an attorney-prepared addendum?
options: A) That the attorney’s name is identified on the addendum
B) That the addendum is pre-approved by the REEB
C) That the addendum modifies an optional provision only
D) That the addendum includes fill-in provisions
questions.explanation: Attorney-prepared addenda must include the attorney’s name for legal compliance.

questions.questionText: What is the primary limitation of using UCC forms in a transaction involving business personal property?
options: A) They cannot be used without prior approval from the REEB
B) They must be filed with the Department of Financial Institutions
C) Only brokers can complete UCC forms, and competence must be ensured
D) They are restricted to transactions involving residential properties
questions.explanation: Only brokers can complete UCC forms, and they must be competent to do so or refer the task to an attorney.

questions.questionText: What must be included in a property management agreement for it to be considered an approved form under Wisconsin law?
options: A) A list of specific tenants
B) Provisions for leasing, managing, and marketing the property
C) A copy of the WB-37 Residential Listing Contract
D) A notarized statement from the landlord
questions.explanation: Approved property management agreements must include provisions for leasing, managing, and marketing the property.

questions.questionText: What happens if a seller fails to provide a Real Estate Condition Report within the required timeframe?
options: A) The buyer can terminate the contract within two business days of the missed deadline
B) The contract becomes void immediately
C) The seller must pay a penalty fee
D) The buyer must proceed with the transaction without the report
questions.explanation: The buyer has two business days to terminate the contract if the seller misses the deadline for providing the report.

questions.questionText: Under what circumstances can a licensee draft an addendum without attorney involvement?
options: A) If it modifies non-optional provisions
B) If it addresses only specific contingencies unique to a transaction
C) If it involves legal provisions like environmental waivers
D) If it rewrites the optional provisions of an approved form
questions.explanation: Licensees can draft one-time use addenda to address specific transaction circumstances.

questions.questionText: What must a broker consider before using another state’s form in a transaction?
options: A) Whether the form complies with Wisconsin law
B) Whether the broker is legally permitted and competent to use the form
C) Whether the REEB has approved the form for interstate use
D) Whether the client has requested the form’s use
questions.explanation: Brokers must ensure they are legally permitted and competent to use another state’s form.

questions.questionText: What is a risk associated with using an unapproved listing contract for a bank-owned property?
options: A) The contract may not comply with Wisconsin agency disclosure laws
B) The contract cannot be enforced in court
C) The contract automatically voids upon signing
D) The contract does not allow for negotiations
questions.explanation: Unapproved listing contracts may not meet Wisconsin’s agency disclosure requirements.

questions.questionText: When should an attorney draft provisions instead of a licensee?
options: A) When drafting simple contingencies for a transaction
B) When dealing with complex legal concepts like rights of first refusal or environmental waivers
C) When the form includes blanks for personal property listings
D) When the parties request changes to optional provisions
questions.explanation: Complex legal provisions should always be drafted by an attorney.

questions.questionText: What is required for a pre-prepared addendum to alter non-optional provisions of an approved form?
options: A) It must be signed by both parties before incorporation
B) It must be drafted by an attorney and include no blanks or optional provisions
C) It must be reviewed by the REEB before use
D) It must be attached physically to the approved form
questions.explanation: Non-optional provisions can only be altered by an attorney-drafted addendum with no blanks or optional provisions.

questions.questionText: What must a licensee ensure when using State Bar forms?
options: A) That the forms are not altered in any way
B) That the licensee has sufficient experience to competently use the forms
C) That the forms are used only for residential transactions
D) That the forms are signed by all parties within 24 hours
questions.explanation: Licensees must be competent to use State Bar forms, as these are complex legal documents.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of incorporating an addendum by reference in an approved form?
options: A) To make the addendum optional for the parties
B) To formally include the addendum as part of the contract
C) To ensure the addendum is signed by both parties
D) To simplify the language of the contract
questions.explanation: Referencing an addendum formally incorporates it into the contract terms.

questions.questionText: What is the primary consideration when using a form without WB identification?
options: A) The form must comply with Wisconsin law and include mandatory disclosures
B) The form is invalid for use in any transaction
C) The form must be reviewed by the broker
D) The form can only be used for commercial transactions
questions.explanation: Non-WB forms must comply with Wisconsin law and include mandatory disclosures.

questions.questionText: What happens if a licensee modifies a pre-prepared addendum?
options: A) The addendum becomes void
B) The licensee must have the modifications approved by an attorney
C) The modifications must be referenced and made legible
D) The addendum no longer complies with Wisconsin law
questions.explanation: Modifying pre-prepared addenda without proper authorization violates Wisconsin regulations.

questions.questionText: Who can use contractual forms for transactions in other states?
options: A) Any licensed broker in Wisconsin
B) Only brokers legally allowed to use such forms in the other state
C) Salespersons with broker approval
D) Attorneys acting on behalf of the client
questions.explanation: Brokers must comply with the other state’s laws to use its forms.

questions.questionText: What is a primary risk of relying solely on standard addenda provided by a firm?
options: A) They might not cover all unique circumstances of a transaction
B) They require prior approval from the REEB
C) They cannot include optional provisions
D) They automatically void the transaction
questions.explanation: Standard addenda might not address specific transaction needs.

questions.questionText: What distinguishes a WB-37 Listing Contract from a property management agreement?
options: A) The WB-37 includes leasing and property maintenance duties
B) The WB-37 focuses solely on advertising and finding tenants
C) Property management agreements are pre-approved by the REEB
D) The WB-37 is not suitable for residential properties
questions.explanation: The WB-37 is focused on finding tenants, not comprehensive property management.

questions.questionText: When must a licensee inspect a property and ask the seller about its condition?
options: A) Before marketing the property
B) After an offer is accepted
C) Only if the property is commercial
D) When the buyer requests it
questions.explanation: Licensees must inspect the property and ask the seller about its condition before marketing it.

questions.questionText: What is required for a licensee to use a UCC form in a transaction?
options: A) The form must be pre-approved by the REEB
B) The licensee must file the form with the Department of Safety and Professional Services
C) The licensee must be competent or refer the task to an attorney
D) The licensee must have experience with at least five prior UCC transactions
questions.explanation: UCC forms require competence or attorney involvement to ensure compliance.

questions.questionText: What is the consequence of using a pre-prepared addendum that includes multiple-choice provisions?
options: A) It must be reviewed and approved by an attorney
B) It violates Wisconsin law and cannot be used
C) It is valid if signed by both parties
D) It becomes optional for inclusion in the contract
questions.explanation: Pre-prepared addenda cannot include multiple-choice provisions.

questions.questionText: What must a licensee do when presented with a seller-drafted listing contract?
options: A) Refuse to use the contract
B) Ensure the contract complies with Wisconsin law and agency disclosures
C) Rewrite the contract to meet WB standards
D) Have it reviewed by the REEB before signing
questions.explanation: The licensee must ensure compliance with Wisconsin law and agency disclosure requirements.

questions.questionText: What is the primary purpose of Wis. Stat. § 706.02(2) regarding addenda?
options: A) To require all addenda to be signed by an attorney
B) To ensure addenda are properly incorporated into the transaction documents
C) To mandate that addenda replace optional provisions only
D) To allow addenda to stand alone as independent agreements
questions.explanation: This statute ensures addenda are properly incorporated into transaction documents to document the agreement.
